bwwExcerpt: The Lion King, as originally conceived and designed by Julie Taymor, is a testament to what is possible in live theatre. She makes it clear by the way the actors wear their masks, headdresses and costumes that these are people, and that the story is decidedly human even though it is set in an animal kingdom. She is not only responsible for the staging, but for the design of the costumes, puppets and masks. Paramount Theatre - Seattle, WA Candice McMillan, Seattle's Child:Â Tony Award-winning dire
